summary: This appears to be an email exchange from March 5, 2024, discussing past events related to the Epstein case. The writer ('Pet' or 'Peter Co') confirms a recollection that an individual was prevented from testifying in Jean Luc Brunel's investigation and trial, and was replaced. The email also references a French TV interview where the recipient was crying outside Epstein's Paris residence and later his New York premises, suggesting this may have been a reason for being asked to stop supporting French authorities.

persons.name: Sigrid
persons.context: Mentioned as someone who, along with attorneys, prevented the email recipient from testifying in Jean Luc Brunel's investigation and trial.

persons.name: Jean Luc Brunel
persons.context: A French modeling agent and associate of Jeffrey Epstein, referenced in the context of an investigation and trial where the email recipient was allegedly prevented from testifying.

persons.name: Pet
persons.context: The author of the email, who confirms remembering events as described by the recipient, including the recipient being asked to stop supporting French authorities.

persons.name: Peter Co
persons.context: The name signed at the end of the email ('King Regards, pm Peter Co'), likely the same as 'Pet', the author.

connections.description: Sigrid is implicated in actions related to Brunel's investigation/trial, specifically in preventing someone from testifying.
They are corresponding about shared memories of events related to the Epstein/Brunel case and the recipient's experiences.

events.title: Prevention of Testimony in Brunel Case
events.description: The email recipient was allegedly prevented by Sigrid and attorneys from testifying in the investigation and trial of Jean Luc Brunel, and someone else was sent in their place.

events.title: French TV Interview at Epstein Paris Residence
events.description: The email recipient gave a TV interview in France where they were crying outside Epstein's Paris residence after an antagonistic response from staff behind closed doors.

events.title: Crying Outside Epstein New York Premises
events.description: Following the Paris interview, the recipient was televised crying outside Epstein's New York premises.

events.title: Request to Stop Support to French Authorities
events.description: After the televised emotional episodes, the recipient was asked to stop their support to the French authorities, possibly by the same parties who prevented their testimony.

keyFacts: An individual claims they were prevented from testifying in Jean Luc Brunel's investigation and trial by someone named Sigrid and attorneys, with someone else sent in their place.

The same individual conducted emotional French TV interviews, crying outside Epstein's residences in Paris and New York, which may have led to them being asked to cease support for French authorities.
The correspondence suggests potential interference or discouragement of a witness/victim from participating in legal proceedings related to the Epstein/Brunel case.
The document is a 2024 email, indicating ongoing discussions or revelations about past events in the Epstein case years after the main investigations.
